strings.Value: [Pass the bottle to Ntavi] "Here. I hope you like this."
"Still, why do you need a bottle of wine?"
[Open a bottle of wine ostentatiously and sip from it]
"And why do you need a bottle of wine?"
"Fine, I'll see what I can do."
"I'll think about it."
"I don't have time for this."
"So what did you want to talk about?"
"I admit, we got acquainted very suddenly."
"Where are you from?"
"How did you meet Ekun?"
"Ekun never mentioned you."
"I'd like to know you better."
"Didn't you say before that he doesn't like taverns?"
"A curious story."
"Let's change the subject."
[Smile in response and leave]
"A curious tattoo — a stinging wasp. Does it mean anything?"
"There's a symbol of Calistria on your wrist. Are you one of her followers?"
"Stinging wasp is a symbol of Calistria."
"That is an evasive answer."
"Your Grace." {n}Smiling, {d|Ntavi}Ntavi{/d} nods politely.{/n}

"I wanted to ask a favor. You see, Elina the innkeeper treats me coldly, and I have no reason why! Yesterday, for instance, she argued with me before changing the sheets in my room, and today she refuses to pour me a glass of wine... So I was thinking, she wouldn't refuse if the baron{mf||ess} {mf|him|her}self asks for a bottle of wine?"
{n}Ntavi greets you with a charming smile.{/n}
{n}Casting a warm glance your way, Ntavi nods gratefully.{/n} "Thank you very much! Now if you don't mind..."
{n}The woman's mysterious smile is baffling.{/n}
"Hmm." {n}Ntavi's face is like a mask. She turns away silently.{/n}
{n}Ntavi's laughter is soft and musical.{/n} "What a strange question! Really, why would I need a bottle of wine at a party?"
"Thank you, {name}!"
"As you wish."

"Ah-ha-hah! That's right — when we met for the first time, I had to speak to him, interruptions be damned. What was I supposed to do? I haven't seen Ekun for such a long time, and I was so surprised to hear about him..."
"I'm at your service."

"I grew up in Nantambu, far from here, but never liked that city. I left it years ago, and haven't been back since. I remember leaving it vividly. Little towers covered with bright mosaics dot the horizon, while I lay hidden in the bushels of sugarcane on a rumbling cart, drawn by a lame old donkey." {n}Ntavi laughs.{/n}

"We guarded a caravan together. At first, I couldn't stand Ekun — I took his silence for arrogance. But then a sandstorm forced us to spend a week in a tiny village. We drank everything the only inn had to offer — and got to know each other better."

"You don't say, ah-ha-ha! It can't be!" {n}Ntavi looks at you with a smirk.{/n} "And he is usually so talkative! Keeps talking about himself, his past, his dreams and plans, a couple of jokes here and there."
{n}Ntavi grins, staring off into the distance.{/n} "He behaved somewhat... differently when he was young."
"And old as the world."
"Agreed."
"Well... I just wanted to steal Ekun for a moment. To walk and talk with him, eye to eye. I've known him a long time, and he could definitely use someone to talk to."

"Your Grace is very observant." {n}Ntavi runs her finger over the image.{/n} "This tattoo is a tribute to tradition. It symbolizes the transition from unconscious dogmatic conformity to mindfulness and self-awareness."
"You are well-informed. Yes, I venerate the goddess. In my part of the world, this tattoo is a part of an initiation ritual. It symbolizes awareness of one's desires... self awareness."

"Ah-ha-hah, I'll probably never get used to the straightforwardness of citizens of the {g|River Kingdoms}River Kingdoms{/g}. A wasp is the sacred animal of {g|Calistria}Calistria{/g}... I am one of her followers."
{n}Ntavi keeps smiling as if nothing happened.{/n} "Just so. Know your desires and you'll know yourself."
